desc:
Deletes a message.

This method deletes a message from a conversation.

When used with a user token, this method may only [delete messages that user themselves can delete in Slack](https://slack.com/intl/en-ie/help/articles/202395258-Edit-or-delete-messages).

When used with a bot token, this method may delete only messages posted by that bot.

The response includes the `channel` and `timestamp` properties of the deleted message.

token.desc: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

channel.desc: Channel containing the message to be deleted.

ts.desc: Timestamp of the message to be deleted.

as_user.desc: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with `chat:write:user` scope. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with `chat:write:bot` scope.
